explanation:
The correct calculation determines the fraction of the whole bar represented by one green subsection: \( \frac{1}{4} \times \frac{1}{2} \).  
The student instead computed \( \frac{1}{4} \div \frac{1}{2} \).  
The error stems from interpreting the division of the green section into two parts as requiring division by 2 rather than multiplication by \( \frac{1}{2} \).  
The misconception conflates the action of partitioning a quantity (which requires multiplying by the fractional part) with the operation of division.  
This differs from related errors like confusing fraction division methods or misidentifying the whole, as the mistake is strictly about substituting division for multiplication when scaling by a fraction.
